title: Trump’s Claims About Nigeria Strike Belie a Complex Situation on the Ground
summary: President Trump said the targets of airstrikes in Nigeria were Islamic State terrorists responsible for killing Christians, but experts question his framing.

title: What to Know About U.S. Military Action in Nigeria
summary: Before the strikes on Thursday, President Trump said he would halt all aid and go in “guns-a-blazing” to target affiliates of a resurgent Islamic State.

title: Snow Begins Falling in New York City, Threatening Havoc
summary: Streets were brined, plows were ready and flights were canceled as the metropolitan region braced for up to 11 inches of snow.

title: Downpours Ease in Southern California, but Flood Risks Remain
summary: Another wave of rain was hitting the Los Angeles area on Friday, adding to the record-setting precipitation over Christmas.

title: Trump Invited White South Africans to America. One Ended Up in Detention.
summary: An Afrikaner flew to the United States expecting protection. Instead, he has spent months locked up in Georgia alongside hundreds of other immigrants.

title: Some G.O.P. Senators Join Democrats in Urging Trump to Adopt Hard Line With Putin
summary: The president is planning to meet with the leader of Ukraine in Florida just as the lawmakers are applying some pressure.

title: Why Sears’s Last Great Hope Was a Promise That Never Materialized
summary: Only five Sears stores remain in the country, with the end likely near for what was once the mightiest American retailer.

title: What It’s Like When Your Wife Goes on Testosterone
summary: She went on testosterone to help with her menopausal symptoms. The effects had unexpected consequences for their marriage.

title: Testosterone Is Giving Women Back Their Sex Drive — With Side Effects
summary: There is no F.D.A.-approved testosterone product for women. Insurance won’t cover it. Many doctors won’t prescribe it. It’s become a cultural phenomenon.

title: A Wealth Tax Floated in California Has Billionaires Thinking of Leaving
summary: It’s uncertain whether the proposal will reach the statewide ballot in November, but some billionaires like Peter Thiel and Larry Page may be unwilling to take the risk.

title: How Ryan Wedding, a Canadian Olympic Snowboarder, Turned into a Drug Lord
summary: Ryan Wedding rose to fame as a Canadian Olympic athlete, but the authorities say he became one of the world’s biggest drug lords, who ordered an informant executed.

title: Annette Dionne, Last of the Celebrated Quintuplets, Dies at 91
summary: She was the first to crawl, the first to cut a tooth, the first to recognize her name, and the last to die. And, like her sisters, she resented being exploited as part of a global sensation.

title: Northern California Conservatives Are Frustrated They Could Get a Democratic Representative
summary: The passage of Proposition 50, which redrew California’s congressional map, means that all of the state’s conservative north is likely to be represented by Democrats.

title: The Race to Save the Sacramento Mountains Checkerspot Butterfly
summary: The Sacramento Mountains checkerspot butterfly is critically endangered, with the last known larva living in a lab in New Mexico.

title: Perry Bamonte, Guitarist and Keyboardist in the Cure, Dies at 65
summary: A former roadie, Mr. Bamonte joined the band in 1990. He played on five albums and in hundreds of shows and was “a vital part of the Cure story,” the band said.

title: Sick of Trump News? I’m Here for You.
summary: Here are the best nonfiction essays of the year, according to me.

title: Trump Is Getting Weaker, and the Resistance Is Getting Stronger
summary: It’s become easier to imagine the moment when Trump’s mystique finally evaporates.

title: Israel Recognizes Somaliland, Drawing International Rebukes
summary: The development carries potential benefits for both sides but still faces stiff international opposition, 34 years after the region broke away from Somalia.

title: What Can Hundreds of Pieces of Litter Tell Us About Manhattan?
summary: Shoes. A phone. Receipts. A comb. Traces of wild nights and hurried days are all around us.

title: CVS Worker Fatally Stabbed on Christmas Day on Long Island
summary: A 23-year-old CVS employee was killed on Thursday in Lindenhurst, the authorities said. A person of interest has been identified.
